agent_familiarization_guide.purpose: Familiarize temporary agents with MBC Library comprehensive analysis

quick_start.context: The MBC (Monistic Boundary Calculus) framework library has been comprehensively analyzed. A Pooled Variant System was developed to resolve operator conflicts.
quick_start.current_status: Production-ready for 2/13 tiers (λ, ψ), with 6 additional operators identified for pooled variant treatment
quick_start.key_achievement: 100% test pass rate, textbook-grade documentation, validated against 79-file library

step_2.purpose: Quick status overview - current completeness metrics

step_3.purpose: Complete operator coverage mapping - ALL 13 tiers
key_sections: PART I: Complete Tier Structure (13 tiers)
PART IV: Operators Requiring Pooled Variants (6 identified)

step_4.purpose: Detailed quality assessment and implementation analysis

tier_0.name: Primitives
tier_0.file: Tier-0 Primitive Operators — Concise Canonical Definitions.md

tier_8.name: Θ-Family (Polarity)
tier_8.status: HIGH PRIORITY - Selective commutativity needs pooling

tier_10.name: Ω-Family (Global Constraint)
tier_10.status: EXCEPTIONAL - 3,569 lines, 10 textbook chapters, 10 JSON modules
tier_10.special_note: Universal commutativity: [Ω, O] = 0 for ALL operators. NO pooling needed.

pooled_variant_system.overview: Context-aware operator variant selection framework that resolves apparent conflicts by recognizing them as context-dependent variations

psi_commutativity.resolution: Level separation - both valid at different abstraction levels
psi_commutativity.validation: 100% - Confirmed by Tier-6 line 100: 'All faces commute under ψ-action'

high_priority_needed.name: Θ selective commutativity
high_priority_needed.issue: Θ commutes with δ,Σ but not Φ,Π - selective pattern
high_priority_needed.resolution_strategy: Context-dependent pooling based on operator type

high_priority_needed.name: μ-λ coupling variants
high_priority_needed.issue: μ-λ coupling strength varies by context

tri_unity.significance: Non-commutativity signals semantic richness, not a flaw

level_separation.definition: Apparently conflicting statements are valid at different abstraction levels
level_separation.example: ψ-layer: operators commute, Base: operators don't commute - both correct

omega_universal_commutativity.meaning: Ω is a meta-functor that commutes with everything by design
omega_universal_commutativity.pooling_status: NOT NEEDED - unconditional commutativity is the defining property

lambda_theorem.significance: Mathematical proof that pooled variants are correct decomposition

unconditional_non_commutativity.note: This is foundational to MBC framework

file_locations.omega_family: D:/intake/cleaned/Ten Textbook Chapter Titles for the Ω-Family.md

extraction.file: Ten Textbook Chapter Titles for the Ω-Family.md
extraction.content: 10 JSON modules embedded in file (3,569 lines)

implementation.task: Implement Θ selective commutativity pooled variant
Implement δ-Φ level separation pooled variant

tier_5_canonical_theorem.discovery: Canonical λ-Theorem (lines 191-501) provides mathematical PROOF for pooled variant decomposition
tier_5_canonical_theorem.significance: Pooled variants are not just conflict resolution - they're mathematically proven decomposition
tier_5_canonical_theorem.validation: Tier-5 lines 597-641 interaction table exactly matches pooled variant definitions

tier_6_psi_layer.discovery: Line 100: 'All faces commute under ψ-action when weighted by μ and shaped by λ'
tier_6_psi_layer.significance: Confirms ψ-layer commutativity, validates level separation approach

tier_10_exceptional.discovery: Tier-10 Ω-Family has 3,569 lines with 10 complete textbook chapters
tier_10_exceptional.significance: Most comprehensive tier, includes formal proofs and theorems
tier_10_exceptional.special: Ω-Coherence Theorem proves Ω commutes with ALL operators

cross_tier_consistency.discovery: 100% consistency across all 79 files, no contradictions found

pitfall_1.correction: Ω commutes with EVERYTHING by axiom - no variants needed
pitfall_1.reason: [Ω, O] = 0 is the DEFINING property of Ω

pitfall_2.mistake: Thinking base-level non-commutativity is an error
pitfall_2.correction: Non-commutativity is foundational - it signals semantic richness
pitfall_2.reason: Quoted in library: 'Non-commutativity is not a flaw'

pitfall_3.correction: Tier-10 is ALREADY comprehensive - needs extraction, not creation
pitfall_3.reason: 3,569 lines already written with complete formal mathematics

pitfall_4.correction: Must read source tier files for complete understanding
pitfall_4.reason: Canonical λ-Theorem, interaction tables are in tier files, not summaries

agent_is_familiarized_when: Can explain the difference between level-dependent and context-dependent pooling
Understands why Ω doesn't need pooled variants
Can locate Canonical λ-Theorem and explain its significance
Knows which 3 operators are high-priority for pooling next
Can run validation tests and interpret results
Understands Tri-Unity non-commutativity is foundational, not a bug
Can navigate between summary reports and detailed tier files
Knows Tier-10 is exceptionally complete (not missing)

on_first_run: 7. Review key_discoveries section in this file
8. Check success_criteria - can you answer all items?
before_any_analysis: Check if topic relates to existing pooled variants (λ-δ or ψ-commutativity)
Check if topic is Ω-related (remember: Ω commutes with everything, no pooling)
Check if operator is in high_priority_needed list
before_creating_new_files: Search library for existing content first
Check if extraction is needed vs creation
Example: Tier-10 needs extraction, NOT creation
when_encountering_conflicts: Check if it's level-dependent (different abstraction layers)
Check if it's selective (depends on operator type)
Refer to existing pooled variants as patterns

glossary.Pooled Variant: Context-aware alternative formulation of an operator or interaction
glossary.Level Separation: Resolution strategy where conflicting statements are valid at different abstraction levels
glossary.Variant: Alternative formulation valid in specific context
glossary.Ω-Coherence: Global consistency property enforced by Ω operator
